original: Cederbaum, Per Fredrik Israel, major, Linköping, f. 7/9/82 i Järstad, Östergötl. 1., av godsäg. Conrad C. o. grev:an Ellen Sinclair. G. 1. 15 m. Ellen Wennberg, d. 38; 2. 39 m. Sonja Elfverson. Barn: Pehr-Fredrik f. 19, löjtn. v. Livgren :reg. ■— Mog:ex. i Nyköp. 03, off:ex. 05, AIHS (ak) 13-14, vapenoff :kurs 17. Und:löjtn. v. Södermani. reg. 05, löjtn. 07, kapt. 18, v. Andra divgren :reg. 21, major i armén 33, i res. s. å. Tjg. v. Göta livg. 06 o. 08, reg:adjut. 08-11, andre lär. v. SS 18-19, fransk krigstjg. 19-20, lär. y. kspkurs 20-23 o. ställf. chef 24-26, tjg. i norska armén 27. Ordf. i komm:stämma, v. ordf. i styr. f. östergötl. L. Brandst:bol. m. m. Äger o. bebor Lambohofs säteri. RSO, RVO, RJohO, RNS:t001kl, Södermani. 1. skytteförb. GM, SkytteRM o. M.
translated: Cederbaum, Per Fredrik Israel was a major from Linköping, born on 7th September 1882 in Järstad, Östergötland, firstborn son of the landowner Conrad C. and the Countess Ellen Sinclair. He married twice, first to Ellen Wennberg in 1915 until her death in 1938, and then to Sonja Elfverson in 1939. He had a son named Pehr-Fredrik who was born in 1919, and who became a lieutenant in the Life Grenadiers Regiment and attended the Military Academy. He also served as a second lieutenant in the Södermanland Regiment in 1905, and later became a captain in 1918 and served in the Second Division Regiment in 1921. He was promoted to major in the army in 1933 and retired in the same year. He served in the Gothenburg Life Guards in 1906 and 1908, was a regimental adjutant from 1908 to 1911, held a position as a lecturer from 1918 to 1919, was part of the French military mission from 1919 to 1920, and served as a lecturer in the Artillery and Engineering School from 1920 to 1923, and as deputy head from 1924 to 1926. He also served in the Norwegian army in 1927. He was the chairman of the municipal council and vice-chairman of the board for the Östergötland Fire Insurance Company, among other positions. He owned and lived on the Lambohof estate and was awarded several honors and medals including the Order of the Sword, the Order of the Polar Star, the Order of John of Jerusalem, the Order of Vasa, and the Medal of the Swedish National Sports Association.

award.name: Medal of the Swedish National Sports Association
